name: hepatic steatosis
description: Hepatic steatosis is characterized by fat buildup in liver, which is seen as hypodensity on CT scans, often with liver appearing less dense than spleen, and on MRI, fat causing signal loss. Ultrasound shows liver as brighter due to fat, affecting how sound waves pass through.

attributes.name: presence
attributes.description: This indicates the presence of hepatic steatosis.

values.name: absent
values.description: This signifies that no hepatic steatosis is present.

values.name: present
values.description: This indicates that hepatic steatosis is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: It cannot determine whether hepatic steatosis is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: It suggests that it cannot be determined whether hepatic steatosis is present.

attributes.name: severity field
attributes.description: It indicates the degree of fat accumulation in the liver.

values.name: mild
values.description: It signifies a small amount of fat accumulation in the liver.

values.name: moderate
values.description: It indicates a moderate amount of fat accumulation in the liver.

values.name: severe
values.description: It represents a severe amount of fat accumulation in the liver.
